metadata.synopsis: To either the mockery or complete surprise of other gith, Lae’zel now is reconciling the fact she essentially has a relationship with the player going on. She might pretend that it isn’t, call it something else, furiously deny that it is anything like what the humans have… but call it what you will, the hallmarks are unmistakable, and she will eventually admit that she wants this more than anything else.Player can put the idea of Laezel abandoning her duties after the Tadpole problem is over and running away together. This replaces her generic outcast ending with the romance ending. Player can still choose the Vlaakith or Orpheus ending at the end, but also have an option to choose the Romance enging.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - queue NIGHT_Laezel_Romance3- Long rest in Lower City and go to bed

30.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel appears, leaning over the player's bed with a sincere smile, shaking them awake..

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.text: Get up. There's something you should see.

5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stands from their bed and faces Lae'zel. She straightens out and smiles wider.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: I know it's early. But this couldn't wait.

11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade back in. Player and Lae'zel sit on the roof of the Elfsong Tavern. The sun is just about to rise.

83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tthe camera moves to show the sun beginning to rise over the horizon. Soft light covers the faces of the player and Lae'zel in a beautiful orange glow.

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: I used to hate that sight. The glowing sky, the long shadows, the fading stars.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: I lived for the red of blood and the black of death. Now I see the colours between.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: Look at the sun. What do you see?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Hope. Life. A future worth fighting for.

89.speaker: Lae'zel
89.text: The dawn was my torment. Rustling leaves, agony. I couldn't wait to escape this place. Now, I revel in it. I revel in you.

21.speaker: Lae'zel
21.text: You showed me the betweens and beyonds. Between war and peace, beyond passion and obsession.

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: Most importantly - you showed me freedom.

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: There's more, but - but I don't know how to say it. I don't know what to call it. I just know whatever comes next, I want you near.

87.speaker: Lae'zel
87.text: When all this is over, will you stay with me? For good?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I've been waiting so long to hear those words. I will stay with you, come what may.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: One step at a time. But for now, I'm not going anywhere.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: One step, then. Maybe even two - if I should be so lucky.

53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel reaches her hand towards the player's.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Smile bashfully and keep your hand to yourself.

82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel smiles back but she does not hold player's hand.

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj. Source of my joy.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black after line.NodeContext: ZHAHK vone-fin DOO. Said with love.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I can't take your hand. But I'll gladly look after your heart.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I liked the sex. But I'm not ready for commitment.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'm not sure, Lae'zel. You can be a lot to handle.

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: I know. I'm stubborn, I'm rude, I'm pushy. Maybe I always will be. But I'm also loyal and protective and ferocious.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: And I've learned other ways, too - the ways of affection and devotion. First, you were my wound; now, you are its cure.

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: You have taken the whole of me. I could never accept just a piece of you in return.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I just can't say no. You have me for good.

81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel says nothing but smiles wide. She takes the player's hand and they watch the sun.

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj. Source of my joy.
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black after line.NodeContext: ZHAHK vone-fin DOO. Said with love.

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel's smile fades. She nods, with slight sadness and stands. She walks away, then looks back over her shoulder.

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking back over her shoulder. Fade to black after line.NodeContext: Sadly, but with strength. ZHAHK vo-nahsh DOO.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: What a joke. I'm done with this.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: A flaming ball in the sky that provides heat and warmth.

80.speaker: Lae'zel
80.text: Literal - but not wrong. I see something else.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: A new day means new battle. I'm in no mood to fawn over sunrises.

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: Trust me, my bones ache for battle too. But look closer - you might see something else.

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: You showed them to me. Thank you for that. But - ugh, tsk'va. I thought this would be easier.
19.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel about to break up with player

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Go on, say what you have to say.

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: I can't deny that I feel for you. But you are a - a distraction. I belong to Vlaakith. I cannot be yours. You cannot be mine.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: I value you as a friend. As an ally. But my future lies only in the red and the black.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Please, stay with me. I don't want you to go.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Get out of here. I can hardly stand to look at you.

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: At end of line, Lae'zel stands and walks away, then looks back over her shoulder.

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: It's better this way. Trust me.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: At end of line, Lae'zel stands and walks away, then looks back over her shoulder.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I understand. Your queen must be your priority.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Only in Vlkaakith may I find light.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Really? You've never been short of opinions.

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: If only you knew how much went unsaid.

66.speaker: Lae'zel
66.text: You have stirred my soul, and more besides. But I belong to Vlaakith. I cannot be yours. You cannot be mine.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I know what this is. You want to sever our bond.

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: It's not that I want to. It's that I must.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: Everything's fine, trust me. Now come.

56.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Lae'zel reaches down and pulls the player up from their bed by their hand. Fade to black.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I'm sleeping, Lae'zel. Must you make this a habit?

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: I'll make it worth your while. I promise.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Of course. I could never resist you.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: All right. This better be good.

91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel stands from the bed, walks away, then turns back to look at you.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: Zhak vo'n'ash duj. Source of my bruises.
